page.title: 01Rural Area West of Meldrum
page.content: Highist land on three sides and centrally with valley rolling to East comprises this quiet rual area with mixed farming, crops (mainly barley, but some wheat, coats, oil seed rape and turnips)slightly predominate over cow and sheep pasture. Fractionally more deciduous than coniferous trees. House sparse - 73 dewllings - 23% farm/croft, cottages - tied 16% rented, 15% unoccupied 8% new houses 10% converted 14% council: originally agricultura 10% privately owned 4%. People not involved in farming commute mainly to oil-related industries.Since public transport is limited - one service twice a day three times a week ran on a trial basis this summer - no facilities (eg schools, shops) being available, two vehicles per family is normal. One new property provides boarding kennels. A gun club uses a
